description: About Stockly Stockly is a retail-tech company that targets to solve the problem of out-of-stock products in e-commerce. With our technology, e-retailers can keep selling out-of-stock products, making other retailers ship them directly to consumers. Our product is live across Europe and convinces more clients every day. Our mission is to create the world first global inventory for retail. To better understand what we do, check out  our French pitch at BFMTV , or  our English pitch at Techstars . The BI is currently composed of  Maria  and  Anouar . You can apply even if it is to start in 6 months! Position [This is not a Data â€œScientistâ€ position, there are no Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence components for now] To tackle our cross team challenges, you are a candidate willing to actively participate to the company development. We are growing fast, there is space for every amazing people! âš™ï¸ About how we work Every team has a  daily meeting  to align on priorities and solve issues â‡’  You wonâ€™t be left alone! description: Who we are Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialised in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing. Our purpose? Ev ery day we boost our clientsâ€™ data transformation into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations.  Our strength? Our data services stand on a double expertise: the combination of Artificial Intelligence and the business prowess acquired from our customers around the world, such as AccorHotels, Orange, Carrefour, Engie, Samsung, L'OrÃ©al, Nissan...   Artefactâ€™s success comes from a unique mix of company assets: cutting-edge data technologies, agile methodologies for fast delivery, cohesive teams assembling the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital marketing experts. Artefact is : 13 offices in Paris, London, Shanghai, Dubai... 900 employees 4 practices: Data Consulting, Data Marketing, Activation and Creation   What you will be doing: Key responsibilities As a Data Analyst, your role will encompass: Conducting projects to accompany the transformation of your clientsâ€™ businesses through the effective collection, processing, and visualisation of data Extracting valuable insights from our clientsâ€™ marketing-related data sources. Designing dashboards for marketing decision-making while taking into account the business needs Accompanying our clients in the conception and implementation of data architectures and data pipelines, from collection to monitoring. Actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the Data & Analytics team Closely collaborate with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consulting, Data Science and Data Engineer) to provide comprehensive services to your clients   Qualifications: Education & experience required Having an academic level of education (Bachelor or Master), in a data-driven working environment, you have experience or have knowledge in : A minimum of 1 year of work experience in a data-driven working environment 1 or more data collection (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, SQL database, CRM database, transactional data) 1 or 2 programming languages among SQL, Python and/or R. 1 Data visualisation tool (Tableau, Data Studio, Dataviz, R / Python dataviz libraries, ...) Ideally, you have the knowledge or take interested in one or more of the following technologies: 1 Google Cloud Platform resource (Big Query, Google Cloud Storage) or its equivalence in Azure or AWS You know how to connect to an API through the knowledge of the different authentication method (OAuth, HTTP Basic, API key) 1 advertising tool, linked to tracking and/or analytics in a marketing context (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, DMP, DSP, Adservers, DV 360...) 1 ETL tool (Airflow, Dataiku, Dataflow, Dataprep...) 1 web application (R-Shiny, Python Flask) that you have industrialized As a bonus, you have: Basic knowledge of statistics Basic knowledge of machine learning and data engineering   What we are looking for A Doer:  you get things done and inspire your colleagues to do the same An Analyst:  you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions based on facts A Pragmatist:  you have a no-nonsense mindset that seeks for practical and realistic solutions A Mentor:  your clients and teams naturally seek you out for advice An Adventurer:  youâ€™re an entrepreneur constantly looking for business opportunities   Why you should join us Artefact is the place to be:  come and build the future of marketing Progress:  every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn Culture:  join the best team you could ever imagine Entrepreneurship:  you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We wonâ€™t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry! Come join us!   #fr

What great looks like â­ï¸ Assist the App Marketplace Team in achieving their team objectives by applying your expertise in analytics and a data-centric approach. Build & continuously improve commercial and product business intelligence providing actionable insight, predictive analytics & forecasting modeling. Enable the team to derive descriptive and diagnostic insights autonomously. Strong stakeholder engagement across Partnerships, Engineering, Product, and Revenue Operations teams and domains. Design analytics data models and tables, which will act as the single source of truth for KPIs and analysis for the App Marketplace team. Be an active member of the competence group (share knowledge and context, give feedback on and participate in the competence groupâ€™s activities/initiatives). Your Responsibilities ğŸ“‹ Analyse the marketplace performance and impact of integrations against business goals & objectives, and identify areas of opportunity the team can examine to improve integrations and optimize effectiveness on Marketplaces. Develop analysis, insights, and dashboards for users across the App Marketplace team that cover commercial and product use cases and unlock value for senior leadership and business teams.   Collaborate with product managers, engineers, etc. to identify and define data analysis requirements.    Identify, scope, build, maintain, and continuously improve the analytics needed to run them on a day-to-day basis using internal BI tools, such as Metabase & Looker and other data streams. Communicate results, learnings, and process changes to a wide audience of stakeholders, both technical and non-technical. Drive data literacy initiatives and empower the stakeholders to make data-informed decisions. Your colleagues say you are ğŸ‘‡ An experienced staff analyst (this is a senior role within our structure), with excellent hands-on knowledge of SQL and strong know-how of translating business cases into analytics opportunities.   Experienced with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, or similar. Experienced with data modeling or have prior experience working with tools such as DBT.  Excellent with written and verbal communication, able to communicate with clarity and empathy on insights and recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders for decision-making. A strategic self-starter, curious and passionate about the possibilities and opportunities to solve business problems with data.   Great at understanding the business and customers, and often bringing actionable insights to help further team objectives.  Experienced in analyzing large amounts of complex data sources, clearly synthesizing key learnings, and providing actionable recommendations. Fluent in translating & communicating financial & business impact from the lens of both commercial and product analytics. Structured, and having an eye for details and quality is more important for you than speed Proactive and have a strong sense of ownership and drive Adaptable and open to finding new ways of problem-solving, and able to apply an analytical mindset to business and customer problems, autonomously breaking down complex questions into precise data questions.  Show me the benefits! ğŸ¥ Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!) Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with  your salary in other markets ğŸœ Private health insurance (Location dependant- e.g. Vitality in the UK, Alan in Spain, MÃ©dis in Portugal) to ensure youâ€™re fit in body and mind to do your best work Flexible working: this team are welcome to work remotely Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice Wellbeing days - fully paid days off designed for a slower pace, allowing you to take time to recharge and prioritise self-care Weâ€™re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far  â¤ï¸â€ğŸ©¹ Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously  Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work ğŸ‘¶ All of us have a stake in Pleoâ€™s success - ask us about our equity grant scheme #LI-Remote Why join us? Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means â€˜more than youâ€™d expectâ€™, and itâ€™s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So itâ€™s only fitting that weâ€™d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances. We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldnâ€™t be siloed from the rest of the organisation â€“ they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else. Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is â€˜champion the customerâ€™, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is â€˜succeed as a teamâ€™, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also â€˜make it happenâ€™ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we â€˜build to scaleâ€™, creating lasting solutions that address todayâ€™s challenges and anticipate tomorrowâ€™s needs.So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices â€”and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible  and  make sure you still have time to connect with your team. About your application Please submit your application in English; itâ€™s our company language so youâ€™ll be speaking lots of it if you join ğŸ’• We treat all candidates equally:  If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone  ğŸ˜Š Weâ€™re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. Thatâ€™s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs. When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page.

description: At Greenly, we are on a mission to lead the way in carbon reduction and sustainability. description_entreprise: Founded in 2019 by Alexis, Matthieu and Arnaud, Greenlyâ€™s mission is to allow everyone to easily track their carbon footprint, so they can take part in the fight against climate change. Fintech of the year 2020, French Tech Green20 & French Tech 2030, 2022 LinkedIn Top Startups, Hottest start-up in Paris by WIRED, Greenly is now the leading carbon tracking technology. Since its foundation, more than 10 million people and +1600 companies have trusted Greenly with their carbon footprint report. Fundraising: $23M

description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst intern to strengthen the R&D department focused on three challenges: Internal Optimization Empower all teams by providing them with clear, reliable, and comprehensive data. Enhance the impact of our sales team by implementing lead scoring to predict which salesperson should handle which lead. Proactively engage with the Customer Success Management (CSM) team by identifying early indicators that may lead to potential customer loss. Gain a deeper understanding of how our customers use our products, including process mining, with the broader goal of personalizing/simplifying the platform based on user profiles. Product Work Conduct statistical analyses of the purchasing behaviors of our end customers to assist them in better understanding their user base. Create a feature based on predicting the cancellation rates of athletes for their classes, allowing them to anticipate with theoretical overbooking. Develop a feature based on predicting the final fill rates of classes to suggest dynamic pricing to studios. Strategic Management Define and implement metrics at different levels, either globally or by team.
 The bsport data stack comprises a datalake consolidating all available data, a functional data pipeline (Airflow) on AWS infrastructure, and well-integrated visualization tools like Metabase for optimal project launches. The role, directly supervised by the Lead Data, collaborates with various team managers, including the CDO, Head of Sales, Head of CSM, and future COO. Compensation ranges from â‚¬1100 to â‚¬2000 monthly, depending on the profile.
description_entreprise: Weâ€™re a Barcelona-based company and we combine the boutique fitness industry with the newest generation of technology to provide studios and businesses with an All-in-One platform to streamline their operations and to maximise their commercial success ğŸŒŸ Three years ago, we launched our platform, and today we have a presence on all continents, translated into five languages, and available in over ten currencies. Currently, we have secured a total of â‚¬4 million in funding from investors such as Seventure Partners, Bpifrance, and Seed4soft.  Thanks to their support, we have amassed over 1,200 partners in more than thirty countries, a team of over a hundred dedicated employees working towards our goal of becoming the leading European provider of software solutions for fitness boutiques. Born in Paris, we have now relocated to the sunny city of Barcelona ğŸš€

description: We are seeking a full-time Data Analyst to join our R&D team. A functional data pipeline, Airflow, hosted on our AWS infrastructure. Well-integrated visualisation tools, such as Metabase, included in the stack.

description: Context on the Data Integration Data is a cornerstone for Seyna. Data will allow us to differentiate ourselves from our competition and it will help us protect the future of our insurance company. This can only become true if our data is of high quality, and efficiently processed. We exchange with more partners daily: we receive data from the brokers and distributors that sell our products, then analyze and process it, before sharing our results and insights with our ecosystem. Exchanging data with our partners presents an increasing challenge as our business grows : increasing volume, data diversity, and increasingly diverse sources. The Data Integration Manager makes sure exchanging data with Seyna is as easy for our partners, while still meeting our internal requirements. She also owns the quality of the data - checking that the data we received is correct. Your Missions: As a Data Integration Manager you will : Help our partners with their data integration process (onboarding and run) Design custom APIs on a day-to-day basis, for each new partner integrating with Seyna Work with our Data Engineer to make the integration as easy as possible. Collect the partnerâ€™s data. If not fully automated, you integrate it yourself into Seynaâ€™s ecosystem. Check data consistency regarding accounting & business rules (e.g. premium acquisition rate vs receipt emission, reinsurance cession rate, written premium vs receipt emissionâ€¦) Automate the data quality process and make it more efficient Assist the team with the data monitoring and data analysis Shape the future of data integration at Seyna ! Our Current Stack Data integration Deployed on AWS with AWS CDK (IaC) Coded in Python

Seyna already empowers insurance brokers to grow their business. It provides a platform which combines tailor-made insurance products and advanced SaaS (Software as a Service). By building their business on Seynaâ€™s platform, brokers can create unique and personalized insurance experiences, from underwriting to claims handling. The platform automates administrative and compliance tasks, freeing up brokersâ€™ time to spend with policyholders. Seynaâ€™s goal is to shift the â‚¬560Bn EU P&C market onto Seynaâ€™s platform. And theyâ€™re off to a great start. The leadership team includes experienced operators from insurance and high growth technology companies. Seyna raised â‚¬47 million total investment from Global Founders Capital, White Star Capital, Elaia, Allianz and La FinanciÃ¨re Saint James â€“ including a record â‚¬33 million Series A in December 2021. Since its launch in 2019, when Seyna acquired an insurance company license, the platform has enabled over 100 insurance brokers who use Seyna to protect over 1 million policyholders. They have a very ambitious mission with tough problems to work on. Itâ€™ll only be possible if we have the best team. Join us !

description: Data Analysis & Strategic Insights : Dive deep into complex data sets representing shopper behavior to extract actionable insights. Your analyses will inform strategic decisions, helping to refine product features, improve unit economics, and guide the development of future product roadmaps. CRM & Buyer Journey Optimization : Oversee the management of customer relationships, with a focus on enhancing the buyer journey. Utilize data-driven strategies to increase engagement, improve retention, and drive sales on the platform. Cross-functional Data Collaboration : Work closely with various departments, including marketing, product development, and sales, to provide data-driven insights. Your role will be crucial in ensuring that decisions across the company are informed by robust, analytical insights. Operational Data Management : Monitor key business metrics and manage the operational aspects of data analysis and CRM. Build and maintain automated dashboards and reports to enhance company-wide understanding of key metrics and shopper experiences. Marketplace Insights & Innovation : Actively contribute to the evolution of the platform by using data insights to identify new opportunities for marketplace expansion and innovation. Your role will involve spotting trends, predicting future market demands, and proposing strategies to attract and retain users, reinforcing Jamble's position as a leader in the sustainable fashion marketplace. Project Management & Execution : Manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment. Ensure that data analysis and CRM strategies are executed effectively, aligning with Jamble's broader goals and contributing to the platform's success. Profile At least 2-4 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Science role BA/B.Sc in Statistics / Math / Engineering/ Economy or other quantitative fields Strong Excel skills Advanced knowledge of statistical tools and models is an advantage At least two years of analytical work experience, preferably for a web or mobile company, or in the e-commerce industry Strong SQL with experience in querying large, complex data sets Experience working with Amplitude High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to details Ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations Fluent in French, High proficiency in English Benefits Lunch vouchers (Swile) Healthcare (Alan) Desk at Voodooâ€™s office (awarded Best Office Space in Paris)

description: â­ About the team: Made up of six subteams (Dashboard, Engine, Infrastructure, Integrations, Threat Research & Security), the DataDome tech team is spread across Europe and the US. We handle over 2 000 billion events per day giving responses within 3ms (99p). We are present in more than 25 data centers around the world, deployed using Docker. We deploy on AWS, Scaleway, Vultr, and GCP, using Docker, Ansible and Terraform, and monitor with Grafana and Prometheus. We handle an average of  8 billion requests per day and manage more than 300 TB of data per month. When it comes to our stack, we run real-time detection layer in Java, low latency Stream Engine running on Flink in Scala, ElasticSearch for storage, Kafka for communication between layers, HAProxy for load balancing, Symfony & Angular for our dashboards. We use Slack, GitHub, Hangouts, & StackOverflow for Teams. While previous experience in cyber is not a must, we'll pair you with mentors who will help you bridge the gaps. As #growth is part of our DNA, weâ€™ll give you the resources and support you need to develop mastery. We are looking for a Cyber Security Analyst w/m who will be in charge of analyzing the bot traffic collected by our detection platform, creating dedicated data visualizations, helping our customers to decide how to act when they are encounter bot attacks. You will be more specifically in charge of: Be part of our threat research team, collaborate with threat researches and data scientists to challenge our detection engine on a daily basis Analyzing huge web traffic data sets (across more than 100 billions documents) to identify and block malicious traffic Creating automates/scripts to detect outliers in our global traffic Contributing to support by analyzing past attacks to strenghten our detection! Identifying potential attacks and add new alerts to our detection platform ğŸ‘¤  What we look for: Bachelors Degree Required in a relevant field Have a previous experience in (web) cyber security Have a real passion for data and automated attacks mitigation Have expertise on Network or Web infrastructure Bonus points You implement bots during your spare time You have already used Kibana You have worked with DBs like ElasticSearch Whatâ€™s in it for you? Flex Life:  Flexible remote, hybrid or in office options, including working from our Paris office, located next to the Opera Garnier + 500â‚¬ stipend to help you set up your ideal workspace. Generous Health Benefits:  Leading healthcare providers for each EU country (e.g. Alan in France). Professional Development : #Growth is part of our DNA, therefore we provide an annual stipend to invest in yourself. Events & Teambuilding:  Feel the #TeamSpirit both virtually & onsite, with several events & workshops planned throughout the year, including two annual offsite events, summer & winter parties, lunch & learns, & much more. Perks:  we prefer to adapt to what works best for you. Some prefer lunch on us, others prefer sports with friends, therefore we believe BotBusters should decide what works best for them. Parent Care:  Gift & care packages for parents. PTO:  Based on the country you are based from (e.g. 25 days in France). What are the next steps? Talent Acquisition Manager will contact you for a first chat You will then meet with CÃ©line You will complete  case study The final step will be a one-on-one meeting with Gilles our CTO Welcome to DataDome! ğŸ¦„ DataDomeâ€™s bot and online fraud protection detects and mitigates attacks with unparalleled accuracy and zero compromise. Our machine learning solution analyzes 3 trillion signals per day to adapt to new threats in real time. Hundreds of enterprises worldwideâ€”including Reddit, Patreon, and AngelListâ€”trust DataDomeâ€™s solution and 24/7 SOC experts to protect their mobile apps, websites, and APIs against online fraud, ATO, carding, scraping, layer 7 DDoS, credential stuffing, and more. A force multiplier for IT and security teams, DataDome is fully transparent, easy to deploy, and frictionless for consumers. We offer the only secure, user-friendly, and privacy compliant CAPTCHA integrated with our complete 360Â° bot detection solution. With 25+ regional PoPs and autoscaling technology, DataDome responds to requests with zero latency and no impact on the speed of protected platforms. In 2022, DataDome was ranked the top  G2 Leader in Bot Detection & Mitigation , named a Strong Performer in the  Forrester Wave: Bot Management , and placed 21st in cybersecurity on the Inc. 5000. Certified a Great Place to Work in the US and France, DataDomeâ€™s dedicated team of BotBusters spans the globe as far as its high-profile customer base. DataDome is an equal opportunity employer, and proud to be committed to diversity and inclusion. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age.
description_entreprise: DataDome is a global cybersecurity company specializing in protection against online fraud and advanced cyberattacks. Their mission is to free the web from fraudulent traffic. Their experts use artificial intelligence-based technology to detect and block the most sophisticated â€œbad botsâ€ in real time. Using their innovative products and solutions, Datadome is changing the standard for online fraud protection: proudly protecting over 250 companies worldwide, including TripAdvisor, The New York Times, Foot Locker, Patreon, Carrefour, BlaBlaCar, ZocDoc, Veepee and Reddit. The company is fully remote-enabled, allowing the 160 â€œBotBustersâ€ spread around the world (and they are actively recruiting!) to collectively protect their customers from malicious traffic.

description: Weâ€™re on a mission to help organizations contextualize the environment they operate in. At Echo Analytics, we work with companies from all over the world. We create, combine, and convert thousands of public and private datasets into meaningful geospatial insights and provide the most accurate commercial Point of Interest (POI) product and mobility insights available in Europe. What do we do? We provide companies with fuel to power their products with high-quality geospatial-based datasets. We use data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build the most comprehensive geospatial datasets and insights available in Europe and rapidly expanding.  Echo partners with companies from multiple industries such as retail, mobility, smart-cities, real-estate, advertising, market-research, and financial services. Who are we looking for? We are looking for a Data Analyst to be in charge of all the data deliveries (data extraction or data analysis)  from our Data Lake to our customers. To be successful as a Data Analyst, you should have prior data experience, be able to collaborate with team members, be a strategic problem-solver and an inspiring data visionary. You also need to have business or client experience. The opportunity Our stack runs on Google Cloud Platform. You will work in an environment made up of Data Lakes (BigQuery, etc.), data streaming platforms (Pub/Sub, Dataflow..), orchestration and scheduling platforms (Airflow), modern deployment (Terraform), and management platforms (GCP). You will manage all the data extraction in coordination with the product and  customer success team.  This is a unique opportunity to be part of a highly promising  start-up in its early stage and play a vital role in establishing and expanding its market. Your Role at Echo Weâ€™re currently scaling the team and hiring talents to grow faster. You will be responsible to : Understand the product / customers requirements and specify the strategy to extract the data Provide visibility on the deliveries to the business. Ability to lead an end-to-end project. Ability to work in a big data environment, different platforms and technologies. Provide data analysis to obtain the requested data (raw visit, dwell time, cross visitation...) using data sciences such as normalization, extrapolationâ€¦ Write complex and efficient SQL queries to transform raw data points from our data lake into reliable business use cases. Ensure data is clean, consistent and accurate. Be a technical guide to various business entities and data marts. Train data users on SQL and analytics best practices. Create clear and easy to understand technical documents that explain fully the datasets created. Continue learning new skills thanks to the Echo Analytics knowledge plan Resolve complex problems coming from the data.  Ability to communicate and work with cross-functional (both R&D and Commercial) teams.  What weâ€™re looking for: Fluency in English (French is a plus) At least 2 years of experience in Big Data, Data warehousing in tier-1 software companies. 2+ years of experience in Data Analysis in Python/SQL/R. An experience in Data Visualization in Python or other BI tools. An experience in project management is a plus. Strong organizational skills. Comfortable working with the Google Cloud Platform stack. Strong experience in Agile Methods (Lean is a plus). Working knowledge in DevOps: GitHub CI/CD, Terraform, Notion, Jira or other Project Management tools. What we offer: The opportunity to join an early stage fast-growing start-up and to scale with us A great international team based in Paris A contemporary office space in the center of Paris (Wework, place de Clichy, Paris 09) Remote-friendly policy Free coffee and snacks Weekly team lunch Healthcare: Alan  An amazing and supporting work environment focused on your professional growth and development Hiring process: 1/ Screening with RaphaÃ«lle, Talent Acquisition Manager  2/ Technical interview with Angela 3/ Technical Test : logical game (live) with a DE + Angela  4/ Cultural fit Delivery team + 1 sales

With a â€œpeople firstâ€ philosophy guiding everything they do.

description: In 2024, Swan anticipates significant revenue growth, primarily driven by the expansion of existing partners. The optimization of our end-user funnel, specifically focusing on Onboarding & Usage, is crucial. The data team will collaborate closely with different teams (Technical Account Manager, Account Managers, and Customer Success Managers) to provide insights and recommendations to partners on workflow optimization. Additionally, collaboration with the Product team is essential for recommending optimizations to our product. âœ¨  Your mission As a Product Data Analyst at Swan, your mission is to be a product expert within the data team, focusing on Swanâ€™s product and use cases. You will conduct in-depth analyses of product complexities, analyze usage patterns, and provide actionable insights to the Product team to help define the roadmap. âœ¨  Main Tasks: Collaborate closely with the Product team and Account Managers to identify optimization areas that directly impact the growth of our clients. Write actionable insights and recommendations, presenting findings to key stakeholders (top management, clients, Account Executives, Product Managers). Build reusable data marts and dashboards. Perform deep dive analysis of each part of our usersâ€™ funnel, delivering actionable insights and recommendations that directly impact Swanâ€™s client growth. Gain adoption and buy-in from Product Managers to implement changes, monitoring project progress and its impact. Communicate findings and results to key stakeholders. Actively participate in day-to-day data operations, including generating and maintaining weekly/monthly reports, identifying and addressing data quality issues, answering ad-hoc questions, and prioritizing data requests. âœ¨  Your team Reporting to Romain, our VP of Data, you will join our new Data team, which includes Antoine, our Data Engineer, Yujun, our Data Analyst, and Alexandre, our Data Analytics Engineer. This is an exciting opportunity to become part of a dynamic and growing team, making a significant impact on the future success of Swan.

description: At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. More than 40% of all food produced in the world is wasted and retailers lose between 1-3% of their annual sales due to food waste, all of this waste has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.  The Retail Technologies teams at Too Good To Go are working on our new software solution, the Too Good To Go Platform, used directly by Retailers to track and redistribute surplus food seamlessly. This B2B app, connected to our consumer marketplace, helps stores better manage expiry dates by; detecting products that are about to expire, recommending what to do with them, and facilitating their redistribution (via discounting for in-store customers, donations to charities, or sales on the marketplace). This business app is already used by tens of thousands of store employees every day, and soon to be hundreds of thousands by the end of the year in several countries.  Weâ€™re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste. Weâ€™re growing fast: Our community of 80 million registered users and 197,000 active partners across 17 countries, have together already prevented 266+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 665,000 tonnes of CO2e! The Role As a Senior Product Analyst in the Retail Tech Product team, your mission is to provide analytical and product expertise to ensure that we are continuously delivering value to our Retailer Partners and to our business. You will analyse various types of data sets in order to deliver high-level insights and actionable recommendations, and work with prototyping new concepts and means of utilising data as a value-add.  In particular, you will have to: Partner with Product Managers to drive strategy based on insights from analyses and experiments Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for your product team Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas Establish, and monitor common metrics that align with team goals and product strategy Ensure features are tracked, tested and documented Ensure that the product team understands and has access to the metrics and insights from your analysis. Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments

description: Context: We are looking for Data Asset Owners (DAOs), the Product Owners of data assets accountable for the delivery, relevancy, and accessibility of their data assets.  DAO prioritizes and manages the development of its data assets. He works with Data management team, consumers of this data, the delivery team, the run team, the security team, etc â€¦. to ensure that data assets get built efficiently and meet user needs. He also manages the setup of features such as observability and SLOs once defined with the stakeholders. DAO is the key point of contact for any request throughout the data asset lifecycle. He qualifies demands (initial need, new features, â€¦) and defines functional requirements to help technical teams fulfill business needs. He is also accountable for data asset remediations where he ensures the proper resolution of incidents by soliciting relevant stakeholders (run team, D&A platform team, Data Governor, etc â€¦). He manages accesses and defines sharing policies of the data asset. description: We are looking for a talented Senior Data Analyst, deeply passionate about data-driven decisions and transforming raw data into clear actionable business insights, who will play a key role in the development of Blitz, our real-money gaming platform. Analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of hundreds of thousands of players to address strategic and operational business questions Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from game data to shape features, game economy, and future product roadmap Work closely with the product, tech and live ops teams to drive insights that will drive towards monetization and retention improvements Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate understanding of key business metrics and playersâ€™ experience Our stack Data:  Athena, Redshift, Airflow, DBT, Tableau/Redash Blitz App & backend: AWS Cloud Services: S3, DynamoDB, Kinesis, SNS, SQS, SES, Kubernetes, Lambda Ops: Jenkins, Git (Github/Bitbucket), AWS CLI, Microservices architecture, Continuous delivery Database: SQL (PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (DynamoDB), MongoDB Cache: Redis Mobile: iOS, Android Productivity: Trello, Slack, Notion, Discord, GDrive Profile You have a passion for mass-market mobile apps and games BA/B.Sc in Statistics / Math / Engineering/ Economy or other quantitative fields 3+ years of experience Ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations True passion for understanding consumersâ€™ social gaming behavior and tolerance for ambiguity Experience setting up tracking and a/b testing plan for a mobile application or game Be fluent in French and English Experience in the Gaming industry, especially with mobile casual games, is a plus  Experience in the Gambling industry, is a plus  Experience working with Mixpanel, is a plus  Advanced knowledge in statistical tools and models, is a plus

description: JOIN DECATHLONâ€™S ANALYTICS FACTORY  The BU Data in Decathlon has the mission to accelerate data usage and commercialization, leading the ambitious Digital revolution in Decathlon Group. At the heart of the BU data, the Analytics Factory teams work closely with the product & business teams to scale up data usage at Decathlon. Our team has a key impact in providing product & business teams with insights and accelerating Decathlonâ€™s digital transformation in over 60 countries.  The Analytics teams are composed of about 40 people in 4 main domains: Sport & Process, Supply Chain, Digital Products and Customer-User Experience.  We are hiring a senior Data Analyst in Customer Growth scope based in Paris, Lille, or Amsterdam. He/she will  be part of an exciting and growing international journey together with Decathlon. RESPONSIBILITIES   Build scalable analytic frameworks to generate insights for Decathlonâ€™s Customer and Marketing Ecosystem such as Identity, Campaign Incrementality, Loyalty Program, Lookalike Marketing.   Design, drive and analyze results of experiments such as A/B tests and Causal Inferences.  Partner with key stakeholders such as Product Managers, Business Managers, Engineers and Data Managers to be able to qualify their needs and translate them into relevant data analysis.   Drive analytics studies to improve Decathlonâ€™s understanding of customer behaviors and potential growth strategy such as Churn, CLTV, Segment, Affinity, Relevancy.  Identify and quantify opportunities for new business and product development; Turn business and product problems into actionable insights.   Mentor junior data analysts and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.  SKILLS YOU'LL NEED    5 years of relevant industry experience working in large scale plateforme or B2C Digital marketing environment   Background in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Data Science.   Experience designing A/B tests.   You speak fluent English and French is a bonus.   Strong knowledge of SQL, Python and statistics is a must ; advanced analytical and machine learning knowledge is preferred.   You want to join a company with a positive impact (#Tech4Good)  NICE TO HAVE   Experience with the causal inference is a plus  Experience in User Growth/Growth Hacker is a plus  DECATHLON DIGITAL CONTEXT  What if technology allowed us to push the boundaries and take sports experiences to new levels? That's exactly our goal at Decathlon Digital! We are a team of 5,000+ experts in software engineering, product management, data, cloud, and cybersecurity, distributed across Paris, Lille, and Amsterdam. Together, we are creating the largest digital sports platform, leveraging tech innovation from design to value chain optimization, connected experiences and product second life. Changing the game for good . We are in this for the love of sports. And like everything we love, we want it to last. Thatâ€™s why we are embarking on a journey to create a more sustainable tech model, reducing our direct environmental impact while maintaining a safe, diverse, and inclusive space for all our people to learn and thrive together. Team up with us to design the digital future of sports.

description_entreprise: The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. Itâ€™s a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures. Beauty is a powerful force that moves us. We know that beauty is more than just looking good. Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others. We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development. Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beautyâ€¯in terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity. Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services. Because we value diversity,â€¯we leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty. Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles. And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware thatâ€¯everything we do can have a meaningful impact. Therefore: We act to shape the future of beautyâ€¯by leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature. We act to drive social innovationâ€¯by offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees. We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heartâ€¯by ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve. We act to nurtureâ€¯lasting partnershipsâ€¯with our clients and suppliersâ€¯based on mutual trust and collaboration. We act to protect the beauty of the planetâ€¯by fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

description: Aircall is a place where voices are valued. Backed by over $220 million of investment since 2015, we create technology that fuels accessible, transparent and collaborative communication to empower our base of 18,000+ customers (and growing) to make authentic, human connections. Conversation is a cornerstone of our culture. Wherever our people find themselves in the Aircall world â€“ Paris, New York, Sydney, Madrid, London, Berlin, or at home â€“ everyone has a voice that is valued. Whatever your background, wherever youâ€™re from â€“ we want you to join the conversation. Letâ€™s talk. Aircall is recruiting a  Data Analyst  / Data Scientist intern  from  March 2024 for a 6-month period.   The central data team is an organization-enabler aiming at systematizing data-driven decisions within Aircall. It plays a key role in impacting product development and business growth by delivering data products, tools and actionable insights. You will have to work cross-functionally with the teams that fuel the company revenue such as Sales, Finance, Product, Marketing and Customer Relations and translate their  data needs  into valuable solutions.    We are looking for someone with a strong business sense and an interest in data analytics and data science. Your mission @ Aircall! Collaborate transversally with business and/or product teams to identify  pain points and propose data-driven solutions, Create, monitor and optimize our real-time  dashboards, Provide  punctual analyses  and  insights  to teams using  SQL or Python, Development & deployment of data models  using dbt/ using Python  for additional analysis or integration tasks, Contribute to the effort on company wide  data governance, awareness and accessibility, Promote a  data culture  within Aircall by creating source of  truth data sets  and empowering teams to be more autonomous with their data. A little about you Currently studying to obtain a  Master degree  in a business or engineering school or at the end of your education, Comfortable manipulating data in  SQL,  knowledge of  Python  for data analysis and  BI  tools such as  Looker  is appreciated, Curious, problem solver, eager to learn, Outstanding analytical and communication skills to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders Fluent in English, French is a plus. #LI-MM2 Aircall is constantly moving forward. Weâ€™re building new roads to complete our journey, and weâ€™re taking people with us who have the same builder mentality. Letâ€™s grow together: Aircall is a place for those who dare to be bold and seek responsibility, excellence, and the opportunity to push themselves to new heights. Weâ€™re creating a place where great people trust one another and thrive together. People flourish at Aircall and now is the time to be part of the team and the journey weâ€™re on. Why join us? ğŸš€ Key moment to join Aircall in terms of growth and opportunities ğŸ’†â€â™€ï¸ Our people matter, work-life balance is important at Aircall ğŸ“š Fast-learning environment, entrepreneurial and strong team spirit ğŸŒ 45+ Nationalities: cosmopolite & multi-cultural mindset ğŸ’¶ Competitive salary package & benefits DE&I Statement:  At Aircall, we believe diversity, equity and inclusion â€“ irrespective of origins, identity, background and orientations â€“ are core to our journey.  We pride ourselves on promoting active inclusion within our business to foster a strong sense of belonging for all. Weâ€™re working to create a place filled with diverse people who can enrich and learn from one another. Weâ€™re committed to ensuring that everyone not only has a seat at the table but is valued and respected at it by providing equal opportunities to develop and thrive.   We will constantly challenge ourselves to make sure that we live up to our ambitions around diversity, equity and inclusion, and keep this conversation open. Above all else, we understand and acknowledge that we have work to do and much to learn. Want to know more about candidate privacy? Find our  Candidate Privacy Notice here.
description_entreprise: Aircall is on a mission to revolutionize the business phone industry! We exist to empower every professional to have richer conversations. Behind our product are the amazing teams driving it, split between Paris, New York, Sydney, Madrid, London, Berlin and remote locations. Despite our distance, we all work together to drive our product!

description: About us  We are in business to save independent retail in Europe! Across our towns and city centres, unique neighbourhood shops have been overshadowed by large chains and e-commerce giants. To combat this, weâ€™ve created a BtoB wholesale marketplace designed to help independent retailers to compete against larger competitors and thus maintain a connected community of stores, brands and shoppers in the places we live. Established in 2019 in France, weâ€™ve since expanded to other European countries, including Spain, Germany, UK and the Netherlands. Driven by our commitment to customer satisfaction, we constantly innovate to develop cutting-edge tools and services that set new standards in the market. Get in touch if you are looking to join a purpose-driven, international team that revolutionizes an old-fashioned industry! Together  Letâ€™s Rewild Retail !  The Team : We are looking for Ankorstore future  Senior Data Analyst specialized in Logistics . You will hold a cross-functional role that bridges our data engineers and our business teams.Working closely with the logistic team youâ€™ll have a unique opportunity to have a meaningful impact on our customers and to get a 360 view on the e-commerce BtoB supply chain (transportation, fulfillment, cross-border shipping). Main responsibilities :  Help us refine and implement our vision of a data driven company Bring your expertise to provide game-changing and actionable business insights through data Transform complex business problematics into clear data driven solutions with actionable business outcomes Strong involvement in the development of the logistics data architecture : Maintain a high standard on data quality by owning data processes, layers of the data warehouse and best practices Leverage data to support operational processes, in-depth research of defects trends and daily operational monitoring  Build the products that will empower our teams to monitor their key performance indicators and drive accountability Help and train our business analysts to understand our data and use our tools Requirements :  At least 2+ years of experience as an analyst in a tech startup, in a global corporation or in a consulting firm Analytical skills  - You like to answer complex business questions through data. You are able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw insightful conclusions from it Technical skills  - You are proficient in SQL and have experience with Git & GitHub Attention to detail & curiosity  - You do not let important details slip through the cracks! You like to dig into 'strange' trends and find the story behind them Creativity & proactivity  - You can find creative and simple solutions to tricky problems, using new approaches, tools and/or testing new ways of leveraging data Team player  - You always demonstrate a 'can-do' attitude and want to work in a team You are  humble  and like to make others succeed English  fluent Other skills that would add value: You come from a top tier Business or Engineering school You have experience using Python working on a Data Science project You have already used DBT You have experience in the retail industry Benefits/Perks  : At Ankorstore we offer a versatile range of benefits to support employees' well-being and work-life balance, fostering personal growth within an innovative and adaptable work environment. We are a remote-friendly company; depending on your role, you will have a full remote or a hybrid contract.  Remote friendly from Paris on this position . All of our employees are automatically covered by Health Insurance & Life Insurance. Our Health Insurance (Mutuelle) and Life Insurance (PrÃ©voyance) are Alan We have partnered with Swile to provide you with meal vouchers You will have access to  Leeto  a platform that provides you with exclusive discounts, cultural activities, holiday vouchers and more Enjoy health benefits through Class Pass, offering you the flexibility to attend in-person classes, digital sessions, or wellness workshops, keeping you active and engaged 25 days of paid leave +  10  RTT +/- 50% of the annual/monthly/weekly ticket for public transportation Modern  WeWork offices  located in the Opera neighbourhood in Paris, providing a vibrant and inspiring work environment 360Learning , a dynamic learning platform offering engaging, customized training experiences and fostering skills development across the entire organization PS : Due to the end of year period, do not expect an answer on your application before January 2024. Ankorstore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to promoting diversity. We donâ€™t discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.
